rev.diff:
Line 3: Line 3:
'''Pico-ITX''' is a PC [[motherboard]] form factor announced by [[VIA Technologies]] in [[January 2007]] and demonstrated later the same year at [[CeBIT]]. The Pico-ITX form factor specifications call the board to be 10 x 7.2 cm (3.9 in x 2.8 in), which is half the area of [[Nano-ITX]]. The processor can be a [[VIA C7]] or a [[VIA Eden]] V4 that uses VIA's NanoBGA2 technology for speeds up to 1.5 GHz, with 128KB [[L1_cache|L1 & L2 caches]]. It uses [[DDR2]] 400/533 [[SO-DIMM]] memory, with support for up to 1[[Gigabyte|GB]]. Video is supplied via [[AGP]] by VIA's [[UniChrome]] Pro II [[GPU]] with built-in [[MPEG-2]], [[MPEG-4|4]], and [[WMV9]] decoding acceleration. The [[BIOS]] is a 4 or 8 [[Mbit]] Award BIOS.<ref>{{cite web|title=VIA Pico-ITX Form Factor|url=http://www.via.com.tw/en/downloads/whitepapers/initiatives/spearhead/pico-itx_form_factor.pdf}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=VIA EPIA PX-Series Pico-ITX Mainboard Homepage|url=http://www.via.com.tw/en/products/mainboards/motherboards.jsp?motherboard_id=472}}</ref>
'''Pico-ITX''' is a PC [[motherboard]] form factor announced by [[VIA Technologies]] in [[January 2007]] and demonstrated later the same year at [[CeBIT]]. The Pico-ITX form factor specifications call the board to be 10 x 7.2 cm (3.9 in x 2.8 in), which is half the area of [[Nano-ITX]]. The processor can be a [[VIA C7]] or a [[VIA Eden]] V4 that uses VIA's NanoBGA2 technology for speeds up to 1.5 GHz, with 128KB [[L1_cache|L1 & L2 caches]]. It uses [[DDR2]] 400/533 [[SO-DIMM]] memory, with support for up to 1[[Gigabyte|GB]]. Video is supplied via [[AGP]] by VIA's [[UniChrome]] Pro II [[GPU]] with built-in [[MPEG-2]], [[MPEG-4|4]], and [[WMV9]] decoding acceleration. The [[BIOS]] is a 4 or 8 [[Mbit]] Award BIOS.<ref>{{cite web|title=VIA Pico-ITX Form Factor|url=http://www.via.com.tw/en/downloads/whitepapers/initiatives/spearhead/pico-itx_form_factor.pdf}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=VIA EPIA PX-Series Pico-ITX Mainboard Homepage|url=http://www.via.com.tw/en/products/mainboards/motherboards.jsp?motherboard_id=472}}</ref>
â
[[EPIA]] PX (currently the only motherboard series that uses the Pico-ITX form factor) has been demonstrated running [[Microsoft Windows XP]] and [[Windows Vista]]<ref>{{cite web|title=Via's incredible shrinking mobo line spawns "pico-ITX"|url=http://www.linuxdevices.com/news/NS2154184680.html}}</ref>. Major current flavours of [[Linux]], including [[Fedora Core]] 6 and [[Ubuntu (Linux distribution)|Ubuntu]] 7.10, have also been shown to be able to run on it.
+
[[EPIA]] PX (currently the only motherboard series that uses the Pico-ITX form factor) has been demonstrated running [[Microsoft Windows XP]] and [[Windows Vista]]<ref>{{cite web|title=Via's incredible shrinking mobo line spawns "pico-ITX"|url=http://www.linuxdevices.com/news/NS2154184680.html}}</ref>. Major current flavours of [[Linux]], including [[Fedora Core]] 6 and [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] 7.10, have also been shown to be able to run on it.
